numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that the electricity generation in the world has increased significantly in the last 20 years.
2. The electricity generation in the world almost doubled from about 15 million gigawatt-hours to about 30 million gigawatt-hours.
3. The graph shows that the world still relies heavily on fossil fuels for more than half of its electricity generation.
4. Coal is a fossil fuel.
5. Gas is a fossil fuel.
6. The usage of coal rose slightly.
7. The usage of gas rose slightly.
8. Clean energy usage increased.
9. Wind power accounts for a higher proportion of electricity generation.
10. Solar power accounts for a higher proportion of electricity generation.
11. Other graphs show the composition of electricity generation in various countries.
12. The composition of electricity generation is diverse in these countries.
13. The population of the US is relatively small compared to the population of China.
14. The population of the US is relatively small compared to the population of India.
15. The amount of electricity generated by India is much lower than the amount of electricity generated by the US.
16. The graphs raise many questions.
17. One question is about the reason for fluctuations in world electricity generation.
18. World electricity generation has dips in some years.
19. World electricity generation had a dip in 2019.
20. World electricity generation had a dip in 2008.
21. I wonder if the decline in 2019 was due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
22. I wonder if the dip in 2008 related to an economic recession.
23. I live in California.
24. I have seen a shift in energy consumption in my hometown.
25. In the last few years, some people made decisions to decommission oil rigs off the coast.
26. In the last few years, some people developed new battery storage systems.
27. These battery storage systems work towards being emission-free.
28. Overall, the graphs show how electricity generation has changed over the years.
29. A catchy name could be "The Megawatt Movement".
